metadata.title: CVE-2024-26582 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - high
metadata.description: In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: net:tls: fix use-after-free with partial reads and async decrypt tls_decrypt_sgdoesn't take a reference on the pages from clear_skb, so the put_page() intls_decrypt_done releases them, and we trigger a use-after-free inprocess_rx_list when we try to read from the partially-read skb.

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
